channel.title: Configuring apache
channel.description:
Hey there, I have WAMP 2.0 Installed on my two Windows Server 2003 Machines, but only one of them is set up to be in the DMZ on the router.
Is there any way that I can add a virtual host for a domain on one machine that has the documentroot on the other server like [code]documentroot 192.168.0.154[/code]
? Or do the files need to be on the same physical server?
Also, don't send me to the apache website. I am already on there looking for an answer.
Thanks!

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:233630”][quote author=belbn link=topic=307346.msg2462911#msg2462911 date=1222563358]
[size=20pt]Go me I actually answer the question![/size]

DocumentRoot: The directory out of which you will serve your

documents. By default, all requests are taken from this directory, but

symbolic links and aliases may be used to point to other locations.

DocumentRoot “c:/wamp/www/”

go into your apache settings file, httpd.conf, and find this line.

If the machines have shared hard drives you should be able to just use the documentroot COMPUTERNAME//folder
[/quote]
Please tell me you already knew that runescape3dude…? I thought the point was that networked drives don’t work.[/quote]
They don’t. I tried. Apache does not start (with any combination of things I have tried so far)

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Last bit means we must exterminate them.

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

[size=20pt]Go me I actually answer the question![/size]

DocumentRoot: The directory out of which you will serve your

documents. By default, all requests are taken from this directory, but

symbolic links and aliases may be used to point to other locations.

DocumentRoot “c:/wamp/www/”

go into your apache settings file, httpd.conf, and find this line.

If the machines have shared hard drives you should be able to just use the documentroot COMPUTERNAME//folder

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

runescape3dude:

DMZ just opens all the ports to a single ip. I don’t want port forward because then only a few ports would be open.

So? How many ports do you need open? You could always forward a range, 0 to 65535.

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:18, topic:233090”]No, it means, “Kill [or Death to] the Jews! We must not stand still until they are dead! It is time for revenge! We must exterminate the Jews!”

Also, can’t you swap the harddrives?[/quote]
One server has IDE other has SCSI. I have tried.

Unhandled:

You can’t just port forward?

DMZ just opens all the ports to a single ip. I don’t want port forward because then only a few ports would be open.

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:16, topic:233090”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=307346.msg2462500#msg2462500 date=1222546377]

Why don’t you put everything you want to host on the server that’s in the DMZ?

Because, the DMZ server has less space on it…
[/quote]
So… set your larger one as the DMZ…?[/quote]
The Larger one is less powerfull.

Is there any way to turn off the router’s firewall or put two machines into the DMZ?

@ Your SIG:
Töten Sie die Juden! Wir können nicht stillstehen, bis sie alle tot sind! Es ist Zeit für Rache! Wir müssen die Juden ausrotten!

Does that mean:
Dead are you Jews! We cannot sit still untill all dead are! It is time for ?war?! The Jews must get out
?

Read full topic

item.title: Configuring apache
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:5, topic:233090”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=307346.msg2458385#msg2458385 date=1222368204]

Why would you put WAMP on Windows Server…

It is better than what comes with it. That is why.
[/quote]Why not just use XP, etc.?[/quote][quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:233090”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=307346.msg2460080#msg2460080 date=1222452566]

Why would you put WAMP on Windows Server…

It is better than what comes with it. That is why.
[/quote]Why not just use XP, etc.?

Why not just use LAMP on Debian, real men do.[/quote]
@PWND:
It is a machine with server hardware, so XP won’t work.
@UNHANDLED:
The fans become uncontrollably loud when I have it running on any form of linux. So, WS2k3 is the only good option.

Read full topic
